intro: Carduus eriophorus var. spurius, commonly known as the spurious sowthistle, is a variant of the common sowthistle. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring deeply lobed leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Its botanical characteristics make it a common weed in agricultural settings.
